# Throughput
---
Similar to bandwidth: How much bits can I transfer per unit time. But while Bandwidth refers to the maximum "width", throughput refers to the actual amount of traffic.

Not considereing congestion, link throughput is determined by the width of the shortest link in the network
- In general, the throughput e2e of a route is the min(Rt)

In real life, the bottle neck is usually the end (host side) or start (server side), even though the middle route is being shared by multiple servers and hosts

[
